It features lanceolate, often hairy leaves that are typically shorter than those of the broader-leaved varieties. The plant produces spiny, spire-like inflorescences that bear small, pale yellow to green flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its architectural form and long-lasting foliage.
